Ok, we'll continue in three days, but the Alliance won't be where it 
is.

::Zardus/DevilDuer/Bloodystrike/Reptilica::

Zardus glances in the horizon, seeing the Iron Fist's four shuttles 
fly in. He smiles, looking at the fifth one already in the clearing. 
He turns around, activating his comm-link.

"Alliance members, we're moving to a new location. Anyone in the base 
brace yourselves, anyone not at base, contact the base for new 
coordinates."

He taps a few buttons, issuing a seperation command. Blast doors shut 
in various places of the Alliance base as panels split up, the base 
beginning to seperate. A few seconds later, the base was laying in 
five pieces in the clearing. The left one was the residential area, 
the right one the labs and CR room, back one was the cargo holds and 
weapon rooms, and the front one was the bridge, training room, and 
other such facilities. In the middle sections were the power supply, 
shields generators, and the anti-gravity devices which had mobolized 
the Alliance base in the past (before the anti moble base rule). 
Since the base was disconnected from the power supply, it had no 
power, an all the facilities were shut off, except for the ones in 
the power supply section.

The four IF shuttles fly toward the sections of the base, the one on 
the clearing also flying up to help.

Zardus smiles, taching each shuttle hatch on to a section of the 
Alliance base. His comm-link was flshing with Kluster's message, but 
he was too busy to notice.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
DevilDuer swears as the base shakes, watching the CR chambers and 
other devices shut down.

"We're movin'," he says to Diamond after he recieves Zardus' 
transmission, "Better brace yerself."

He could feel the base lifting into the air, causing him to stumble 
sideways to regain his balance.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Bloodystrike and Reptilica jump back as the door of the Alliance base 
shuts, both of them falling as the base shakes.

"Bloodystrike swears, sliding down the hallway as the section they 
were in was lifted into the air.
